text: Henry Wessel (July 28, 1942 â€“ September 20, 2018) was an American photographer. He was born in Teaneck, New Jersey. He was the recipient of two Guggenheim FellowshipsMathias, James F. Letter to Henry Wessel Jr. March 23, 1971. John Simon Guggenheim Memorial Foundation.TS.Ray, Gordon N. Letter to Henry Wessel Jr. March 15, 1978. John Simon Guggenheim Memorial Foundation.TS. and three National Endowment for the Arts grants. His photographs are included in the permanent collections of major American, European, and Asian museums.Jenkins, William. New Topographics: Photographs of a Man-Altered Landscape. Catalogue. Rochester, NY: International Museum of Photography at the George Eastman House, 1975. His work were exhibited at the Tate Modern in London, the Museum of Modern Art in New York, the Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles, and the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art. Wessel died of lung cancer on September 20, 2018 in San Francisco, California, aged 76.Henry Wessel, prominent Bay Area photographer, dies ==References== Category:1942 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Deaths from lung cancer Category:Cancer deaths in San Francisco Category:American photographers Category:People from Teaneck, New Jersey Category:Writers from New Jersey Category:Writers from San Francisco
title: Henry Wessel Jr.
